page.title: 09The Horns Inn, Otford.
page.content: "The Horns" is a fifteenth century building. Before it became a pub the buildings were three cottages. There are two fireplaces which have been partly bricked up but they are still very large.. The opening hours are really two days for the workers. They get in 20 barrels of beer at a time. The people who run the pub have been there for over 11 years and have lots of helpers. We asked what the most popular drink was. They gave us four answers: whisky, gin, bitter and lager. The most expensive drink was a port n' brandy. The busiest day is Saturday. They have lots of people who enjoy the pub who come in from everywhere. They sell 556 pints of beer a day.
